column2:
"Ooh, it's you.
You're really a big help. Always
coming here and taking care of us."

"I haven'th the chance to check the seals properly.
Sorry but, bear with me for a while."
"Also, I couldn't leave that guy behind."
"I am sure yond those meddling twins art the ones behind the Kuronite's recent aggression. If 't be true we can defeat those folk, i'm sure the issue shall taketh care of itself."
"Thus, mine own course of action is quite clear. I needeth to seek those naughty brats and taketh those folk down myself."
"... No, it's forbidden, Lady Sukuna-hime. You're already weak from before."
"Out of mine own way, Kotoshiro. Thy goddess hests thee, doth thee dare disobey me?"
"If you want me to stand down, you will need to force me. Assuming you still can in your current state."
"1. Both of you should calm down"
"2. Is there no other way?"
"Doth not best alarmed, I'm fine. What Kotoshiro sayeth is correct, I understandeth."
"It's just as <%me> says. We need to consider our options."
"So what solutions can thee bethink of. I would like this to best done apace, so yond as few liveth art hath lost as possible."
"Perhaps you could ask for both the Shironians and the Kuronites for assistance?"
"I'm sure if you were to explain the situation to both kings, they'd be happy to hel--why are you glaring at me like that!?"
"T'would best a waste of our time. Neither king would taketh any action."
"While I'm inclined to agree. However, the only way to know for sure is if we ask."
"Ah, very well, 'twill be sometime before I can taketh action again."
"We shalt useth yond time to at least seek out their views on the matter. Does yond please thee?"
